intro: Eurylepis triflora, commonly known as the three-flowered eurylepis, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that often display vibrant colors. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with opposite, ovate leaves that are often hairy. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
